answer.para:
Please run configure with the parameter --prefix=<your KDE directory>. Then run make and make install as usual.
The KDE directories for the widely used Linux distributions are:
RedHat: /usr SuSE: /opt/kde3 Mandrake: /usr
Alternatively you can run the command "kde-config --prefix" to get your KDE directory. The commands are:
./configure --prefix=<your KDE directory> make make install
Please install the package bibletime-i18n which contains the translations of the daily tips, the handbook, the installation instructions and the Bible study howto.

question.para: Is it possible to search for a specific Strong number?

formalpara.title: Using BibleTime 1.1 - 1.4.x
formalpara.para: You need at least BibleTime 1.1 for this. Turn on the default usage of Strong's numbers in the optionsdialog (Sword->Filter settings). Then open the seachdialog and search for <0120> or any other Strong code.

formalpara.title: Using BibleTime 1.5 or later
formalpara.para: The search interface now offers to set the type of your search. You can choose between headings, footnotes, Strongs numbers and morphological numbers.

question.para: Why do I see only question marks instead of Unicode text?

answer.para: First make sure you have the latest version of the module which has the problems! Check www.crosswire.org/sword for this.

You have to install an unicode font like Code2000, Arial Unicode MS or Bitstream Cyberbit to display the special unicode characters. Check the section "Configuring BibleTime->Options Dialog->Fonts" in the handbook of BibleTime how to setup Unicode fonts under Linux.

question.para: The KJV shows no Strong numbers in the NT

answer.para: You're probably using an outdated version of the KJV module. Please update the module.

question.para: Where can I write down my personal notes?

answer.para: You have to install the module "Personal", which is available as a commentary on Crosswire. Please refer to BibleTime's handbook for more information about the personal commentary.

question.para: Why is one of the two testaments of a Bible module empty?

answer.para: Some modules only contain the text of the old or new testament. Recent versions of BibleTime should only offer the testament which has some content in it.

question.para: Is BibleTime available in my native language?

answer.para: BibleTime is available in several languages, which are all listed on our translations page. The translations are available in the package bibletime-i18n.
If a translation into your language is not available, please consider to help to make it available. More information is available on out translations page..
